abstract: Eve M Kahn Antiques column; scientists and scholars across country are working to determine ingredients of inks on ancient texts; Prof Anne E Dawson has compiled documents and artworks of painter J Alden Weir for exhibit at Lyman Allyn Art Museum in New London, Conn, and book on his time at Windham artists’ colony; Corning Museum of Glass in Corning, N Y, will exhibit 19th-century glass models by Leopold and Rudolf Blaschka.
lead_paragraph: From wine fermentation residue to plant tissue, scholars are delving into the materials used to fashion the ink for ancient manuscripts.

headline.main: Solving the Mystery of Ancient Ink Origins
headline.print_headline: Unlocking the Recipes for Ancient Inks

snippet: From wine fermentation residue to plant tissue, scholars are delving into the materials used to fashion the ink for ancient manuscripts.
